data.title: NBA rumors: Sixers signing Kyle Korver after Suns release him post-Grizzlies trade? Lakers, Bucks also contenders
authors: Zack Rosenblatt | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
data.meta_description: The Philadelphia 76ers are a contender to sign sharpshooter Kyle Korver after he's bought out by the Phoenix Suns.
data.text:
There was a lot of talk about the Philadelphia 76ers “running it back” with their roster from last season.

Maybe they will actually run it all the way back to 2006.

More specifically — the Sixers might be in the running to bring Kyle Korver back to the team that drafted him. The sharpshooter was traded for the second time this offseason on Wednesday, dealt from the Memphis Grizzlies to the Phoenix Suns in a deal also involving former No. 4 overall pick Josh Jackson.

Per ESPN’s Adrian Wojnarowski, the Suns are expected to buy out Korver’s contract, and the Sixers are one of three teams expected to contend for his services. The other two: Lakers and Bucks.

The Sixers, of course, drafted Korver in the second round out of Creighton back in 2003. He was traded during his fifth season with the team to the Utah Jazz.

In the 11 years since then, Korver has remained one of the NBA’s elite three-point shooters and even made an All-Star team in 2015 with the Hawks.

He shot nearly 40 percent from three last season in time split between the Cavaliers and Jazz, who traded him to the Grizzlies earlier this offseason.

After the loss of JJ Redick, the Sixers are severely lacking three-point shooting options on their roster and Korver would provide a major upgrade in that area.

The Sixers don’t have any remaining cap space, though, so they’d only be able to pay Korver $2.5 million, though the Bucks are in the same boat and the Lakers will be if they sign Kawhi Leonard.
